metadata.Title: CVE-2015-1822 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
chrony before 1.31.1 does not initialize the last "next" pointer when saving unacknowledged replies to command requests, which allows remote authenticated users to cause a denial of service (uninitialized pointer dereference and daemon crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via a large number of command requests. Miroslav Lichvár discovered that chrony does't initialize the pointer properly. An attacker could use this vulnerability to cause a denial of service (crash) or execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-1822` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chrony - 1.29-1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chrony package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.29-1ubuntu0.1').
